description: The system generates this notification to indicate that the
cscaFilterStatus of the attack filter for cscaType has changed
due to the reason determined by cscaDescription. The system
limits the generation of this notifications for the same

event.Summary: Status of attack filter for attack type $v2 has changed to $v8

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaFilterChange ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaType i 9999 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaSourceAddressType i 0 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaSourceAddress s EXAMPLE CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaDestinationAddressType i 0 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaDestinationAddress s EXAMPLE CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaAttackedPort u 9999 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaFilterStatus i 1

description: The notification is generated when a start or end of a global
attack is detected in the system.
Below fields are sent with the trap:
entPhysicalName indicates the name of the
cscaGlobalAttackType indicates the type of the global
cscaFilterStatus indicates whether the global attack is
started or ended ie. the attack filter status is activated or
of the attack, whether it originated from network or subscriber

Summary.eval: ($v3 == 1 && $v4 == 1) ? 'Global attack $v2 has started on the network side' : (($v3 == 1 && $v4 == 2) ? 'Global attack $v2 has started on the subscriber side' : (($v3 == 2 && $v4 == 2) ? 'Global ended $v2 has started on the subscriber side' : 'Global attack $v2 has ended on the network side'))

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaGlobalAttackFilterChange ENTITY-MIB::entPhysicalName s EXAMPLE CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaGlobalAttackType i 1 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaFilterStatus i 1 CISCO-SERVICE-CONTROL-ATTACK-MIB::cscaTypeOriginatedByNetworkSide i 1
